skills.name: TypeScript
skills.description: TypeScript is a superset of JavaScript that adds static typing, improving code quality and maintainability. It helps catch errors early, enhances development with better tooling and autocomplete, and compiles down to JavaScript for compatibility with browsers and Node.js.

skills.name: electron.js
skills.description: Electron.js is a framework for building cross-platform desktop apps using JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, powered by Chromium and Node.js. It enables web developers to create native applications for Windows, macOS, and Linux with access to OS features.

skills.name: Expo
skills.description: Expo is a framework for building React Native applications with a streamlined development process. It provides tools, libraries, and services to create cross-platform mobile apps for iOS, Android, and web without needing native code.
